title: Ex-Girlfriend's Mom's Salsa Fresca (Pico de Gallo) Recipe
description: This salsa fresca recipe is a fresh-tasting combination of tomatoes, red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and lime to serve with chips or your favorite Mexican dishes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Salsa Recipes Tomato Salsa Recipes Ex-Girlfriend's Mom's Salsa Fresca (Pico de Gallo) 4.9 (229) 181 Reviews 36 Photos My ex's mom had the best hand-chopped salsa fresca I have ever tasted. Over the years, I have tweaked her recipe to something my friends and family rave about. The trick for this salsa is marinating the onions and jalapeños in lime juice for about 5 minutes before adding the tomatoes and cilantro. Hope you enjoy! Submitted by thebioteacher Updated on May 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 36 36 36 36 Prep Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 cup finely chopped red onion 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely chopped - or more to taste 2 limes, juiced 2 ½ cups Roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and chopped ½ cup chopped fresh cilantro 1 teaspoon salt Directions Mix red onion, jalapeño pepper, and lime juice in a bowl. Allow to stand for 5 minutes. Mix in tomatoes, cilantro, and salt; allow to stand 15 more minutes for flavors to blend. Cook’s Note There are two tricks to this recipe:1. Hand-chop everything. It takes a while, but it is worth it. 2. The marinating is what makes this salsa special. I Made It Print 506 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 29 Calories 0g Fat 7g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 29 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 395mg 17% Total Carbohydrate 7g 3% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 4g Protein 1g 2% Vitamin C 18mg 19% Calcium 19mg 1% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 258mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Ex-Girlfriend's Mom's Salsa Fresca (Pico de Gallo) 01 of 36 Photo by  naples34102 02 of 36 Photo by  Anita Acosta 11/16/2023 I just mixed everything together and waited 20 min.I also didn't use a teaspoon of salt. I just sprinkled it a couple of times and mixed it. 03 of 36 Photo by  Barb 05/09/2020 04 of 36 Photo by  Wright Family 10/09/2019 Added some pepper. Otherwise perfect! 05 of 36 Photo by  LaurieDeer 09/09/2019 I followed the recipe and the results were excellent!! Thank you for sharing. 06 of 36 Photo by  ladylge 07/05/2019 Turned out great! My husband and I both loved it. Slight modifications...used poblano pepper instead of jalapeño, 3 1:2 cups of tomatoes instead of 2 1/2, and sweet onion instead of red onion. I had a big bag of sweet onions, so I didn’t want them to go to waste. Next time I’ll try it with the red onion. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly and it was awesome! 07 of 36 Photo by  caroline 06/17/2019 I'm obsessed with this salsa! I've made it several times already and it's always a hit. Even the juice that's left at the end is delicious, and I may have poured it into a cup to drink once... Yes, the chopping takes some time but it's totally worth it. 08 of 36 Photo by  Lindsey 05/07/2019 Very easy to make. Delicious. 09 of 36 Photo by  Franny 03/20/2019 10 of 36 Photo by  Lalatome1 01/17/2019 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love D's Famous Salsa 1,181 Ratings Toe's Best Salsa 22 Ratings Jen's Fresh and Spicy Salsa 219 Ratings Secret Ingredient Pico de Gallo 26 Ratings Salsa 228 Ratings Spicy Salsa 28 Ratings Cabbage Pico de Gallo 25 Ratings Fresh Mild Salsa 11 Ratings Fresh Tomato Salsa 759 Ratings Fresh Tomato Salsa Restaurant-Style 6 Ratings Hatch Chile Salsa 15 Ratings Cinco de Mayo Salsa Cruda 46 Ratings Simple Texas Salsa 64 Ratings Mexina Salsa Verde 73 Ratings Ancho-Chipotle Salsa 33 Ratings Fresh Homemade Salsa 45 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: thebioteacher
instructions: Mix red onion, jalapeño pepper, and lime juice in a bowl. Allow to stand for 5 minutes. Mix in tomatoes, cilantro, and salt; allow to stand 15 more minutes for flavors to blend.
